20110118230316.000|20110118230318.000|TR0|public want to repeal all provisions -- 
20110118230318.000|20110118230320.000|TR0|all provisions in the new health care law;

20110118230322.000|20110118230325.000|TR0|public believe repeal is the way to go?
20110118230325.000|20110118230327.000|TR0|
20110118230327.000|20110118230329.000|TR0|PELOSI:  Well, I'm not sure that I

20110118230332.000|20110118230334.000|TR0|there are polls that -- that show a

20110118230341.000|20110118230343.000|TR0|of a preexisting medical condition. They

20110118230359.000|20110118230401.000|TR0|that maybe the way it was put together,

20110118230459.000|20110118230502.000|TR0|have comprehensive health insurance.  So 
20110118230502.000|20110118230504.000|TR0|we'll still continue to make the case to

20110118230511.000|20110118230513.000|TR0|it, any one of us, any one of us is one

20110118230925.000|20110118230927.000|TR0|rights, not about health insurance 
20110118230927.000|20110118230930.000|TR0|companies' profits.

20110118230934.000|20110118230936.000|TR0|courts will say it's unconstitutional, the 
20110118230936.000|20110118230939.000|TR0|mandate part, that you must purchase 
20110118230939.000|20110118230941.000|TR0|health insurance?
20110118230941.000|20110118230943.000|TR0|
20110118230943.000|20110118230945.000|TR0|PELOSI:  Well, the argument for a mandate 
20110118230945.000|20110118230948.000|TR0|is that if you're going to lower costs, 
20110118230948.000|20110118230950.000|TR0|improve access and improve the quality of 
20110118230950.000|20110118230952.000|TR0|care, you have to increase the risk pool.  
20110118230952.000|20110118230954.000|TR0|You have to have more people in the poll 
20110118230954.000|20110118230957.000|TR0|to lower the cost and spread the risk.  So 
20110118230957.000|20110118230959.000|TR0|that is essential to the patient 
20110118230959.000|20110118231001.000|TR0|protections.  We believe the way the bill 
20110118231001.000|20110118231003.000|TR0|was written was constitutional.
20110118231003.000|20110118231006.000|TR0|
20110118231006.000|20110118231008.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Do you think -- you think the 
20110118231008.000|20110118231010.000|TR0|courts will go along? What -- how worried 
20110118231010.000|20110118231013.000|TR0|are you about that?
20110118231013.000|20110118231015.000|TR0|
20110118231015.000|20110118231017.000|TR0|PELOSI:  Well, I'm not worried about it.  
20110118231017.000|20110118231019.000|TR0|The court -- most of the court -- whether 
20110118231019.000|20110118231022.000|TR0|there have been 14 decisions, 12 have been 
20110118231022.000|20110118231024.000|TR0|-- have just not addressed it.  One went 
20110118231024.000|20110118231026.000|TR0|against it.  One went in favor of 
20110118231026.000|20110118231028.000|TR0|something like that.
20110118231028.000|20110118231031.000|TR0|

20110118231745.000|20110118231748.000|TR0|
20110118231748.000|20110118231750.000|TR0|The U.S. population is getting older, and 
20110118231750.000|20110118231752.000|TR0|that's raising an important question.  
20110118231752.000|20110118231754.000|TR0|Jack Cafferty is here with "The Cafferty 
20110118231754.000|20110118231757.000|TR0|File" -- Jack.
20110118231757.000|20110118231759.000|TR0|
20110118231759.000|20110118231801.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN ANCHOR:  As snow and 
20110118231801.000|20110118231803.000|TR0|ice cover many of the nation's roadways, 
20110118231803.000|20110118231806.000|TR0|here's something for you to think about:  
20110118231806.000|20110118231808.000|TR0|At what point should elderly drivers be 
20110118231808.000|20110118231810.000|TR0|taken off the roads?
20110118231810.000|20110118231812.000|TR0|
20110118231812.000|20110118231815.000|TR0|America Online reports that elderly 
20110118231815.000|20110118231817.000|TR0|drivers now make up almost 20 percent of 
20110118231817.000|20110118231819.000|TR0|all motorists.  And that number is growing 
20110118231819.000|20110118231821.000|TR0|as the baby boomers age.  It's no surprise 
20110118231821.000|20110118231824.000|TR0|that one recent survey shows almost one in 
20110118231824.000|20110118231826.000|TR0|10 adults are worried about an older 
20110118231826.000|20110118231828.000|TR0|family member driving.
20110118231828.000|20110118231830.000|TR0|
20110118231830.000|20110118231833.000|TR0|Experts say the top thing is to understand 
20110118231833.000|20110118231835.000|TR0|the importance of mobility for the 
20110118231835.000|20110118231837.000|TR0|elderly.  Driving gives them a huge sense 
20110118231837.000|20110118231839.000|TR0|of independence and autonomy.
20110118231839.000|20110118231842.000|TR0|
20110118231842.000|20110118231844.000|TR0|They suggest that if you're worried about 
20110118231844.000|20110118231846.000|TR0|a family member's driving, you should take 
20110118231846.000|20110118231848.000|TR0|a ride with them and watch, and then, if 
20110118231848.000|20110118231851.000|TR0|necessary, have a conversation about it.  
20110118231851.000|20110118231853.000|TR0|Good luck with that.  It's a sensitive 
20110118231853.000|20110118231855.000|TR0|topic, in many cases, for sure.
20110118231855.000|20110118231857.000|TR0|
20110118231857.000|20110118231900.000|TR0|Nevertheless, here are some things to look 
20110118231900.000|20110118231902.000|TR0|out for when a senior citizen gets behind 
20110118231902.000|20110118231904.000|TR0|the wheel.  Stopping in traffic for no 
20110118231904.000|20110118231906.000|TR0|reason, that's a clue.  Difficulty staying 
20110118231906.000|20110118231909.000|TR0|in the same lane, getting lost in familiar 
20110118231909.000|20110118231911.000|TR0|places, being easily distracted or 
20110118231911.000|20110118231913.000|TR0|irritated while driving, difficulty 
20110118231913.000|20110118231915.000|TR0|turning around to see when backing up, 
20110118231915.000|20110118231918.000|TR0|loss in confidence, other drivers often 
20110118231918.000|20110118231920.000|TR0|honking horns at them and scrapes or dents 
20110118231920.000|20110118231922.000|TR0|on the garage and/or the car -- clues, one 
20110118231922.000|20110118231924.000|TR0|and all.
20110118231924.000|20110118231927.000|TR0|
20110118231927.000|20110118231929.000|TR0|There is no specific age when the elderly 
20110118231929.000|20110118231931.000|TR0|have to stop driving. But there comes a 
20110118231931.000|20110118231933.000|TR0|point when they become a danger to 
20110118231933.000|20110118231936.000|TR0|themselves and to others.
20110118231936.000|20110118231938.000|TR0|
20110118231938.000|20110118231940.000|TR0|Many states have special requirements for 
20110118231940.000|20110118231942.000|TR0|senior citizens to renew their licenses.  
20110118231942.000|20110118231945.000|TR0|Sometimes they have to apply for a renewal 
20110118231945.000|20110118231947.000|TR0|more frequently.  In some states, they 
20110118231947.000|20110118231949.000|TR0|need to retake road or vision tests or 
20110118231949.000|20110118231951.000|TR0|renew their license in person, instead of 
20110118231951.000|20110118231954.000|TR0|through the mail.
20110118231954.000|20110118231956.000|TR0|
20110118231956.000|20110118231958.000|TR0|Here's the question:  Should the rules be 
20110118231958.000|20110118232000.000|TR0|tightened for senior citizens who drive?
20110118232000.000|20110118232003.000|TR0|
20110118232003.000|20110118232005.000|TR0|Go to CNN.com/caffertyfile.  Post a 
20110118232005.000|20110118232007.000|TR0|comment on my blog.
20110118232007.000|20110118232010.000|TR0|
20110118232010.000|20110118232012.000|TR0|(CROSSTALK)
20110118232012.000|20110118232014.000|TR0|
20110118232014.000|20110118232016.000|TR0|CAFFERTY:  I'm a senior citizen, and I'm 
20110118232016.000|20110118232019.000|TR0|not giving up my car or thank driver's 
20110118232019.000|20110118232021.000|TR0|license.  Pry it from my cold, dead 
20110118232021.000|20110118232023.000|TR0|fingers.
20110118232023.000|20110118232025.000|TR0|
20110118232025.000|20110118232028.000|TR0|BLITZER:  You're going to get a lot of 
20110118232028.000|20110118232030.000|TR0|e-mail from senior citizens.  We have a 
20110118232030.000|20110118232032.000|TR0|lot of senior citizens watching this show, 
20110118232032.000|20110118232034.000|TR0|Jack. And they will be responding to you.
20110118232034.000|20110118232037.000|TR0|
20110118232037.000|20110118232039.000|TR0|CAFFERTY:  That's from my people.
20110118232039.000|20110118232041.000|TR0|
20110118232041.000|20110118232043.000|TR0|BLITZER:  Thank you.  My people, too.  
20110118232043.000|20110118232046.000|TR0|Thank you, Jack.

20110118233119.000|20110118233121.000|TR0|were there.  It was a very close-knit 
20110118233121.000|20110118233123.000|TR0|group.       And with one thing, talking 
20110118233123.000|20110118233125.000|TR0|about going out to dinner, going for 
20110118233125.000|20110118233128.000|TR0|summer vacation, or this or that.  Mark 
20110118233128.000|20110118233130.000|TR0|said, to her, you know, "Gabby, if you can 
20110118233130.000|20110118233132.000|TR0|hear us, do this, do that.  Open your 
20110118233132.000|20110118233134.000|TR0|eyes, open your eyes."  And she did.  And 
20110118233134.000|20110118233137.000|TR0|she really, you know -- it wasn't just we 
20110118233137.000|20110118233139.000|TR0|imagined it.  You could see the beautiful 
20110118233139.000|20110118233141.000|TR0|blue eyes when she opened her eye.

20110118233143.000|20110118233146.000|TR0|BLITZER:  She had a bandage on the other.

20110118235115.000|20110118235117.000|TR0|Chris in Virginia writes, "I believe the 
20110118235117.000|20110118235119.000|TR0|DMV should modify testing after 70.  My 
20110118235119.000|20110118235122.000|TR0|father exhibits all the signs.  He denies

20110118235128.000|20110118235131.000|TR0|interviewed for a job delivering pizza.  
20110118235131.000|20110118235133.000|TR0|Lord help us all."      Betty in Texas 
20110118235133.000|20110118235135.000|TR0|writes, "I think you and everybody else 
20110118235135.000|20110118235137.000|TR0|ought to leave the senior driving 
20110118235137.000|20110118235140.000|TR0|situation alone.  Remember you, too, will 
20110118235140.000|20110118235142.000|TR0|be a senior one day.  As for me, I don't 
20110118235142.000|20110118235144.000|TR0|need you or the government to tell me when 
20110118235144.000|20110118235146.000|TR0|to quit driving.  In case you're not 
20110118235146.000|20110118235149.000|TR0|aware, most seniors are full of common 
20110118235149.000|20110118235151.000|TR0|sense and will know when to put the keys 
20110118235151.000|20110118235153.000|TR0|away when the time is right."
20110118235153.000|20110118235155.000|TR0|
20110118235155.000|20110118235158.000|TR0|John in Utah writes, "Absolutely.  I'm 64 
20110118235158.000|20110118235200.000|TR0|years old.  It was virtually impossible to 
20110118235200.000|20110118235202.000|TR0|get my parents to stop driving, even 
20110118235202.000|20110118235204.000|TR0|though they were both accidents waiting to 
20110118235204.000|20110118235207.000|TR0|happen.  In both cases we had to take 
20110118235207.000|20110118235209.000|TR0|action with the state to get their 
20110118235209.000|20110118235211.000|TR0|licenses revoked before they killed 
20110118235211.000|20110118235213.000|TR0|somebody.  My only serious auto accident 
20110118235213.000|20110118235216.000|TR0|was when a 92-year-old man ran a red arrow 
20110118235216.000|20110118235218.000|TR0|and I hit him broadside.  The D.A. plea 
20110118235218.000|20110118235220.000|TR0|bargained the old fellow down to 
20110118235220.000|20110118235222.000|TR0|revocation of his license rather than 90 
20110118235222.000|20110118235225.000|TR0|days in jail.  I wouldn't want him to 
20110118235225.000|20110118235227.000|TR0|spend time in the slammer.  He didn't have 
20110118235227.000|20110118235229.000|TR0|much left.  But I also don't want him on 
20110118235229.000|20110118235231.000|TR0|the highway."
20110118235231.000|20110118235234.000|TR0|
20110118235234.000|20110118235236.000|TR0|San Diego, anonymous:  "Hi, Jack.  My 
20110118235236.000|20110118235238.000|TR0|father-in-law lives with us, still drives. 
20110118235238.000|20110118235240.000|TR0| He's 84 and loves his independence.  We 
20110118235240.000|20110118235243.000|TR0|also like him staying alive and not 
20110118235243.000|20110118235245.000|TR0|killing anybody else with his Cadillac. 
20110118235245.000|20110118235247.000|TR0|After 70, there should be an actual 
20110118235247.000|20110118235249.000|TR0|driving test with a human being to 
20110118235249.000|20110118235252.000|TR0|maintain your license every two years.  
20110118235252.000|20110118235254.000|TR0|Dad is going to sell the Caddie when he 
20110118235254.000|20110118235256.000|TR0|turns 85."
20110118235256.000|20110118235258.000|TR0|
20110118235258.000|20110118235301.000|TR0|Dick writes, "I am one and I scare myself."
20110118235301.000|20110118235303.000|TR0|
